cluster_relations.rel_desc: Fairytales are described as a form or mode of storytelling.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a specific form, mode, or sub-type of the broader practice or concept represented by the object.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Cinderella is presented as an individual fairytale belonging to the broader category of fairytales.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a specific instance or individual example of the object class or category.
remarks: Modeled as instance-of to capture that Cinderella is a member of the fairytale genre.
Modeled as instance-of to capture that Cinderella is a member of the fairytale genre.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Snow White is treated as an individual instance of a fairytale.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a specific instance or individual example of the object class or category.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Hansel and Gretel is treated as an individual fairytale.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a specific instance or individual example of the object class or category.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The term 'classic fairytale' categorizes the work 'Hansel and Gretel.'
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject category or label is used to classify or categorize the object entity as belonging to that category.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: AudienceEffect: captured the imaginations of readers

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The Hansel and Gretel story exemplifies the motif of tales where children outsmart witches.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a concrete example or exemplar of the object concept, motif, or category.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: MotifContext: part of a wider set of similar tales

remarks: Relation created to connect an individual tale to the abstract motif entity.
Relation created to connect an individual tale to the abstract motif entity.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: "These tales" refers to the specific named stories, which are a subset of the broader category of fairytales.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject collection or group is a subset of, or fully contained within, the object collection or category.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: ReferentScope: Brothers Grimm collection and the listed classic stories

remarks: Relation created to anchor the anaphoric group 'these tales' within the fairytale genre.
Relation created to anchor the anaphoric group 'these tales' within the fairytale genre.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Fairytales function as a form of storytelling that entertains and inspires.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is used as a means, tool, or medium to achieve or perform the object activity or function.

qualifiers.UncertaintyQualifier: implicit that this is a storytelling function; 'storytelling' not named in this exact clause.

remarks: Relation chosen to capture that fairytales are a mode or tool of storytelling rather than redefining either entity.
Relation chosen to capture that fairytales are a mode or tool of storytelling rather than redefining either entity.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a specific form, mode, or sub-type of the broader practice or concept represented by the object.
args.justification: This relation links 'fairytales' to 'storytelling' with the description that fairytales function as a form of storytelling. Ontologically this is better modeled as a form/mode-of (subtype) relation rather than a usage relation: fairytales are a kind of storytelling, not merely a tool used for storytelling. Aligning it with 'is_form_of' makes it consistent with RelR_15d1498558e4 and with a classification/identity schema instead of USAGE.
args.remark: The entertaining and inspiring effects mentioned in the description are better modeled as separate effect/impact relations if needed, rather than overloading this edge as USAGE.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a specific form, mode, or sub-type of the broader practice or concept represented by the object.
executed_decisions.justification: This relation links 'fairytales' to 'storytelling' with the description that fairytales function as a form of storytelling. Ontologically this is better modeled as a form/mode-of (subtype) relation rather than a usage relation: fairytales are a kind of storytelling, not merely a tool used for storytelling. Aligning it with 'is_form_of' makes it consistent with RelR_15d1498558e4 and with a classification/identity schema instead of USAGE.
executed_decisions.remark: The entertaining and inspiring effects mentioned in the description are better modeled as separate effect/impact relations if needed, rather than overloading this edge as USAGE.
